title: Thunderbirdで、一部のHTMLメールが表示されない

title: Using Windsteam.net email on Mozilla via IMAP
content:
For a couple of years on and off I have been trying to assist a dear friend of mine with his windstream.net account using the Thunderbird email client.

The problem is that while we set up everything quite easily, the account is added, all of his folders are populated and everything is perfect initially within a few hours to a few days....suddenly he begins to receive the following error message: login to server imap.windstream.net with username failed.

At first it will work for a while hitting "Retry". Then after a while it stops sending and receiving email. Eventually I am forced to remove the accounts and begin the cycle again. I can't for the life of me work it out.

So far: I have updated the program. Set up the account from scratch numerous times Updated and changed the windstream email password. Scrubbed the program and all related folders numerous times. Checked for any obvious interference from security apps (currently only windows defender running) Checked for any internet connectivity problems (there were none) Changed around the IMAP settings to use any other combination of settings that would work (there were none) Read all the Mozilla Thunderbird posts on this forum related to Windstream numerous times. Scoured the internet for any other help. So now I'm actually posting about it.

Once again, initially the settings below work just fine, there is nothing but green lights and check marks and everything seems to be fine.....until its not and the cycle repeats over and over. I would welcome any assistance from anyone with experience using windsteam email on mozilla thunderbird or a moderator or administrator if any review these forums. My friend has used the Thunderbird client for many years and does not wish to switch. I will include a few screenshots of the error message. Thank you in advance for any and all assistance! 

   Incoming Server (IMAP): imap.windstream.net    IMAP Port (SSL/TLS): 993    IMAP Port (non-secure): 143    Authentication: Required for both incoming and outgoing servers.    Username: Your full Windstream email address (e.g., your-email@windstream.net).    Password: Your Windstream email account password.

Outgoing Server (SMTP): 

   SMTP Server: smtp.windstream.net    SMTP Port (SSL/TLS): 465    SMTP Port (non-secure): 587
creator: armor611suit

title: Can't receive emails in Thunderbird after upgrade
content:
Thunderbird upgraded itself to version 140.2.0esr (64-bit). I also got a new browser tab for Thunderbird 140 Eclipse. However, now Thunderbird will not receive any new emails. I can see that they're out there via my mobile phone. I don't get any kind of message when I try to receive emails. It's as if it's totally ignoring my request. I have two email addresses - it will not work for either.

Additionally, I am able to send emails out to a gmail address. So the only issue seems to be receiving emails.

Specs: - I have a Windows 11 laptop. - I'm using POP3 (I know, my friends are giving me crap. But I want to keep my emails on my laptop, not on the server. I'm old school that way.).

I've tried requesting emails the following ways: - Hit F5 - Click on File | Get New Messages for | All accounts - Click on File | Get New Messages for | Current account - Click on File | Get New Messages for | <choose the individual account>

I've tried the following to resolve the issue, without success: - I saw online where someone mentioned a bug with the new version. They suggested creating a default account. I already had a default account, but changed it in hopes that it would help. However, it didn't. - I deleted the global-messages-db.sqlite file to try to rebuild the profile (this was also suggested online). The rebuild was successful, but I still could not receive emails.

Can you help me? Thanks very much!

Ken Zwyers
creator: zeker434

title: Odesíláni mailů Thunderbirth
content:
Dobrý den,

v aplikaci Thunderbirth mne nelze odesílat maily s domenového účtu. Chybová hláška příloha Hlášení.

Zasílám náhled nastavení které bylo aplikací generováno automaticky, příloha Automatické nastavení a Automatické nastavení odchozí.

Na webu thunderbirth jsem našel typy jak nastavit aplikaci ručně, příloha vlastní a vlastní nastavení ale aplikace ani po ručním nastavení maily neodesílá.

Dále jsem našel na webech radu, vypnout bránu firewall a zkontrolovat internetové spojení. Toto jsem provedl ale nepomohlo to.

Děkuji za radu.

title: Thunderbird suddenly will not download messages.  Send messages fine.
content:
Thubderbird 140.2.0esr (64-bit), indicates up to date, last update installed 25 Aug 2025, problem encountered 9pm 26 Aug 2025. Thunderbird had been installed and operating normally for over three years.

On 26 Aug 2025, prior to turning off computer, did a final "check for new messages" but no dialogue or error messages displayed (normally 'attaching to server', 'downloading x messages' and/or 'no messages to download' display indicating progress of activity) No messages were downloaded even though attaching directly to the comcast mail server showed there were new messages to download. On 27 Aug 2025 on startup, download of new messages did not occur as it normally did, messages were downloaded manually but no status messages were displayed. No further message download requests have met with success and no status or error messages displayed. It acts as though the "download email from server" function has been deleted or disabled.

Incoming mail server settings appear correct and unchanged.

title: GET MESSAGES icon does not work but will after close/restart. Thunderbird error for 142 release?
content:
I posted this before, but the header for my question was corrupted. Anyway, I am referring to Thunderbird 142 Release 64-bit using Windows 10, email provider comcast.net

I have a better understanding of what is going on. The GET MESSAGES icon in the upper left now never works, i.e. right clicking it. HOWEVER, if you choose another method for getting messages - I use left click on GET MESSAGES - you still will not get messages, BUT IF YOU CLOSE THUNDERBIRD USING THE "X" ON THE UPPER RIGHT HAND CORNER I.E. DON'T "EXIT" AND THEN RESTART THUNDERBIRD AND THEN USE AN ALTERNATE METHOD TO GET MESSAGES (the right click GET MESSAGES icon still will not work but the left click will), THE MESSAGES ARE LOADED. You can repeat left clicking on GET MESSAGES. But you have to do this every time you start or restart Thunderbird and want to get messages for the first time.

title: A newer version of Thunderbird may have made changes to your profile which are no longer compatible with this older version.
content:
A newer version of Thunderbird may have made changes to your profile which are no longer compatible with this older version. Use this profile only with that newer version, or create a new profile for this installation of Thunderbird. Creating a new profile requires setting up your accounts, calendars and add-ons again.

More information… 

THIS NEEDS AN OPTION TO CONTINUE USING OLD PROFILE. YOU JUST MADE THUNDERBIRD USELESS TO ME. DO NOT KNOW HOW TO CREARE A NEW PROFILE. SHOULD NOT NEED TO. CAN NOT START IT AFTER MANY YEARS OF USE. PREFERRED OLD VERSION OF ABOUT 5 YEARS AGO.

title: Effect of end of maintenance of Windows 10
content:
Questions about Thunderbird. For several years I have been successfully using Thunderbird on my desktop computer, using Microsoft and Windows 10. I have been notified that Windows 10 will no longer be maintained by Microsoft after 30 Sept 2025, and users are being encouraged to move to Windows 11, which is mainly designed for computer games, and requires a larger computer than my existing one. I am not interested in computer games, and do not wish to purchase a new computer, when my existing computer is more than adequate for my needs. This raises several questions. Is it possible that I will be able to continue using Thunderbird with Microsoft and Windows 10, even though Windows 10 will not be revised? Is it possible for the same Thunderbird software to be driven by software other than Microsoft and Windows 10? If so, which software? 

      Thank you.                       From: Alastair.

title: Not Receiving Email
content:
I have had Thunderbird on my HP laptop for several years. Everything has worked perfectly. BUT, I cannot receive Email, starting yesterday. When I click the Get Email icon, nothing happens. My Email server on Comcast is getting Email which I can see and read, but Thunderbird is not getting the Email. I would appreciate any advice.

creator: hawkeye62

title: Office 365 authentication with a FIDO2 USB stick in Thunderbird
content:
Hello

Our company uses Office 365 with two-factor authentication. Previously, this worked perfectly with Thunderbird (with IMAP) and TOTP. Now, our IT department has removed this option, as well as authentication via SMS or phone call. The only way to bypass the MS Authenticator app is now with a FIDO2 USB stick. This works perfectly with Firefox, but not with Thunderbird.

When logging in, if I understand correctly, Thunderbird opens its own browser, which doesn't support FIDO2. Is this correct, or is there a workaround I haven't found? And if it is, is there a way to configure Thunderbird to use Firefox (which does support FIDO2) as the browser for logging into Office 365 instead of its own browser? And if that doesn't work either, are there any other ideas? (I use Thunderbird 128.13.0 esr with Debian 12)

I appreciate any feedback that helps me move forward... or, if it doesn't work at all, destroys any hope.

Best regards
creator: info8281

title: My Sent Box is not showing recently sent messages
content:
My Sent Box is not showing recently sent messages.

I looked up this issue on your help site and it said I should repair the Sent box folder. When I did that, all messages from the Sent box have disappeared.

However, if I open up my email on my iPhone, and select the Sent box, all messages are there and current.

How do I get this corrected.

Thanks,
creator: rich.ward1

title: Thunderbird Access to Comcast E-mail
content:
Since late on August 26, Thunderbird on my Dell Desktop cannot access my Comcast e-mail. Comcast support directed me to this page

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/automatic-account-configuration

but when I tried to follow the instructions, I get the error message "incoming server already exists" as soon as I enter my password. After an earlier attempt I turned off "Create Accounts in the New Account Hub" after I received the error message below at the same (enter password) stage

"can't access property "cleanup", this[#configVerifier] is undefined"

I am trying for a POP3 setup. Thanks for all assistance.
creator: blistein

title: Email won't download into Thunderbird following the July 2025 update
content:
Hi there - I'm hoping someone can help. Following the July 2025 update to Thunderbird, I was suddenly unable to download my email messages into Thunderbird from my Rogers Shaw email account. When I try to do so, I get the error message: "Login to server pop.shaw.ca with username failed. I'm given three options - retry, enter new password (which hasn't changed), or cancel.

Does anyone have any idea what might have changed post update?
creator: ElsieH25

title: Syncronize iCal calendars via CalDAV
content: Hi, I am trying to synchronize all my calendars into Thunderbird. I run a Nextcloud instance containing "native" calendars aswell as calendars synced from ics links. With the TB sync addon, I could sync the native calendars as well as the ics calendars. However with the new native provider this option no longer exists.
